intro: Scaphyglottis bifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed marsh orchid, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland and marsh habitats in North America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers moist, nutrient-rich soils. Scaphyglottis bifida is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams, where it thrives in full to partial sunlight. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
